I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay and our spacious accommodations. Nevertheless, I regret that our team left much to be desired in terms of offering you exceptional service. I sincerely hope that this isolated incident does not deter you from returning to our hotel. We would love to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, good breakfast (included) and good staff
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights while attending a conference.   The staff is nice, the rooms a generously sized with a huge tub (though not my thing).   I would say the only thing I did not like was that they allowed smoking outside by the pool.   Parking was fairly easy and they did have copies of USA today in the lobby every day.   I did here the person above me...but I did not hear anyone on either side.  The hot tub was not operational when I was there.

This is a lovely hotel.  The lobby is beautiful, very clean and modern, with several sitting areas.  We stayed in a King Suite, and our room was spacious, very clean, and comfortable.  All of the staff members are very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very kind staff and clean facility.  Everyone was very helpful.
Summary: Very kind staff and clean facility.  Employees get to know you.  Restaurant staff remembers me and my family every time we visit.  My 10 year old daughter refuses to stay anywhere else.  We absolutely love this hotel!!!

We stayed for a couple of nights while on a recent trip to Socal.  It is convienently located close to the 405 freeway, but without freeway noise.  The staff was excellent and always greeted us upon our entry into the lobby.  Our room was spacious and well appointed.  The bathroom was huge.  Everything in the room was in excellent condition.  The morning breakfast buffet had numerous choices and if you went away hungry, it was your fault.  Additionally, the room rate was one of the most economical in the southern Orange County region.  A great choice for a hotel in southern OC.

Booked on Trip Advisor. No issues or problems there. Beautiful property. Clean, and modern. All the usual Ayres quality standards. Good breakfast, not great, but good. Great service, One thing that sets Ayres apart is that everyone smiles and speaks to you. They make you feel special. That is what you are paying for. Great location right off the freeway. Good proximity to beach. Did not use the pool so I can't comment on that. The WiFi in our particular room was terrible, but was okay in the breakfast room and lobby. We only stayed one night, so it didn't affect us. Would stay there again. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in fountain valley area
Summary: Stayed in this hotel for one night on the way to San Diego. Room and hotel interior looks newly renovated. Breakfast was okay, parking is free. They accommodated my request for early check in as well. Friend desk was helpful during early check in process.

I booked the room through the Ayres website.  I was quoted a price and received an e-mail stating the price I was quoted.  When I checked in, I was charged a price that was 35% higher then quoted.  When I questioned the rate, they stated it was because I booked through booking.com. Which was not correct..
Manager Response: Dear ladypepsi427,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. Though I regret that your stay was anything less than exceptional, I cannot thank you enough for the feedback you provided. Please accept my sincerest apologies for the miscommunication on behalf of booking.com. We kindly encourage our guests to book direct so that they can confirm their rate, room type, etc. I truly hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: This was a great hotel! Very clean and the rooms are really spacious. The beds are really comfortable and the breakfast was good. We have stayed at the Anaheim location before so we knew we would have a good night sleep and great stay at Fountain valley.

Staff was extremely friendly, accommodating and helpful.  Lobby was beautiful.  Room was very nice.  Staff was extremely friendly, accommodating, and helpful.  Lobby was tastefully decorated.  Room was first class.  Bed and pillows very comfortable.  We did not eat breakfast in the restaurant as we were meeting friends elsewhere.  But, it looked very nice..

I have never stayed at at Ayers Hotel before. So glad we had the opportunity to stay there for during our tennis tournament. It was so nice we are staying there again this weekend. Beautiful Hotel. Its obvious the owners take pride in their property. The staff is always working to keep it polished, clean and the staff is very friendly. The breakfast was great! I can not say enough wonderful things about this hotel. :)

Staff: was very nice and curtisous when checking in/out.   Location:  very close to 405 freeway. Close to shopping and eateries.  Room:  very clean.  Staff picked up room early in the day.  Bed was harder than we like. Previous stays had softer bed.

Nice hotel, but you can tell not a hotel that caters to business people.  The WiFi which is free and I was happy for that, was horrible at night.  Fine early morning, but at night when people are using it, I couldn't get on.  Had to turn it off on my phone in order to access the internet, my mail, etc.   Very niice breakfast in the morning. One big complaint - other than WiFi - was the smell.  It is like they pump in a "air freshener" when you walk into the room.  It goes away after a bit, but when you first enter the room it is gagable.   Another suggestion - have a recycle trash bin in the room.  Most of my trash was recyclable and the thought of it going into the landfill didn't make me happy.   Other than the above, it was a nice little hotel.  Central location if you are

Beautiful and comfortable room. Bathroom had pubic hair on the floor and the toilet had not been cleaned.   When I called them about it, the attitude was very la-dee-dah about it. They said their housekeeping came in late on Sunday'sand we could use the lobby restrooms in the meanwhile. What's the point of paying for a nice room and an attached bathroom if we have to use the public restrooms in the lobby???  We were there only for one night. It was just a shame we couldn't enjoy the room completely...  Staff needs to be changed and the lazy housekeeping service/schedule definitely needs to be changed very soon.
Manager Response: Dear Anna P,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we use to make improvements wherever necessary. I kindly encourage you to reach out to me personally to further discuss your experience. If you give us a chance to earn back your trust. I can assure you that we will do our best to remedy the situation, you can reach me via email at jmathews@ayreshotels.com or by phone at 714 861 5170 ext. 502.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: When I travel I usually pick the courtyard Marriott when I can and I reviewed all the hotels in the area of fountain Valley being my first time in Huntington Beach I came across this hotel and I was pleasantly surprised and glad that I made the choice to choose this hotel because it was very nice inside the rooms look great the complementary breakfast was outstanding and the staff,their customer service was second to none,like I said before it was my first time in Huntington Beach but believe me I plan on going back and when I do, you can count on me staying at the Ayres Hotel,I liked it that much and if ever you're in fountain Valley I recommend anyone that has a chance to stay at this hotel,do so you won't be disappointed

This hotel is super clean with great rooms that are large and well appointed. We found the hotel to be very quiet even though it was full. The breakfast is actually worth eating and the patio make a great place to eat. With easy access to the freeway, this hotel makes a good base for OC activities.
Manager Response: Dear JustMeToo2011,  Thank yo so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. Your kind compliments regarding our cleanliness and the accommodations we offer are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your review and we hope you choose to stay with us next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: We had a great stay at the Ayres Fountain Valley. Our goal this trip was to relax, hit the beach and do nothing. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean. The location was close to many shops and about a 15 min drive to Huntington Beach. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Chin L,  Thank so much for the valuable input you have provided. I am ecstatic to hear that we were able to provide you with a comfortable and relaxing haven. Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our team and the attentive service they provide. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: A very nice hotel, confortable for the freeways to LA and  to San Diego. Big and well furnished rooms. Very good breakfast. People very kind. It is very close to Huntington Beach which is very  nice for shopping and for having meals. I'd Say perfect.
Manager Response: Dear Raffaella732016,  Thank you for your exceptional rating of our Ayres Hotel Fountain​ Valley. It is a pleasure to provide our guests with wonderful accommodations and service. We hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: I guess I was expecting a little more from this hotel.  Don't get me wrong, it's nice but a little less than expected for the price.  The hotel has a nicely furnished lobby.  The pool is small and didn't have enough lounge chairs, so I ended up sitting in a regular chair while my son swam.  The room was adequate - nice bed, sofa, TV, and larger than usual fridge.  The complimentary breakfast was disappointing - pretty much the same fare you'd get at a Hampton Inn or similar.
Manager Response: Dear mdowd111,  Thank you kindly for the candid feedback that you have provided. Though I am contented that you had an overall pleasant stay, I regret to hear that we fell short of your expectations. We hope that these minor shortcomings do not keep you from returning to our hotel in the future. Thank you again for your candid review.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: We completely enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Hotel, they were very friendly and clean and accommodating for us, we checked in early and dropped off our belongings and headed to LA for the Dodgers vs Red Sox game and returned late at night, it was so nice to come back to a clean room and a very comfortable bed and a clean nice warm shower, thank you very much for welcoming us into your home.
Manager Response: Dear Debbie R,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review of our hotel! I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and the attentive service we strive to provide. Your kind compliments regarding our cleanliness and the accommodations we provide are greatly appreciated. Remember, you are always welcome!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary Heading: what a find!... thanks to Trip Advisor.
Summary: Excellent stay in every way!   Clean, attractive hotel, filling and varied free breakfast, free parking, instant hot water and comfortable beds, and most importantly, friendly, caring service.  We found Ayres Hotel on Trip Advisor when looking for a stay near the Sports Complex in Huntington Beach.  Our team kept winning, so we needed to extend our stay. John Matthews, the manager, made it happen without having to move us around! We walked to a great restaurant for dinner, ate at the Fusion restaurant in the hotel  (varied and delicious!), and even enjoyed live entertainment.  Their commitment to service is very apparent starting with Mr. Matthews.  Like finding a great babysitter, I kind of hate to share this because I'm afraid it will be booked up for our next visit to
Manager Response: Dear parentpathway,  Thank you for your wonderful review. It is great that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our decor, premium amenities, and distinctive service. We look forward to your next visit and we promise to do our best to squeeze you in!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: We come every year to the Ayres as we have family very close by and love it there, the staff is very friendly and helpful every time we come. The facility is clean and very comfortable, and they have a great breakfast too.
Manager Response: Dear Kim D,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. The input you have provided is greatly appreciated. I am contented that you were pleased with the cleanliness of our hotel, the accommodations we provided, and our complimentary amenities. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: nice hotel, very clean, quiet even if the freeway is close, front desk staff warm and professional, rooms are spacious, 15mn from Huntington beach, two complaints A/C was noisy and pool a little bet small , but overall if you are looking  for a short stay in a clean, standard basic hotel Ayres is a good choice   .

A very nice quick birthday getaway  The staff was very helpful and friendly The front seat staff helped out with directions getting around  They are awesome the new girl(traine) was most helpful  The breakfast was a good as well, wish they had bacon

Stayed here for 6 nights whilst visiting Disney, Huntington Beach. Spotlessly clean hotel, nice breakfast and lovely pool area. Ideal base for where we wanted to go.  We also visited Hollywood which was around an hours drive away.  Would certainly recommend this hotel.

I had an amazing time. The food in the restaurant was great and the live music on Thursdays was a plus. I enjoyed my stay and wish I could stay longer. I definitely will be back. Fountain Valley is a beautiful place. Thank You for your hospitality.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay,  great price!
Summary: Great place to stay. Great price!  Staff was great. Gym and pool area fantastic!!  Everything was clean,  organized. I won't stay anywhere else again. Front desk staff was far and friendly. They made great suggestions on where to eat.

The service here was great . Always greeted when coming and going. People at the front desk were very friendly. Shout out to the manage John. Our room was perfect ,clean and cool. (It was a very hot week end)  this is a perfect location as we used to live near by and we know the area well. Also we have family close by. Can't think of any bad to say about it.

We stayed here because we were attending a wedding close by and the bride's family had chosen this hotel for their guests. What a great choice! It was a wonderful experience from check in to check out. The room was clean and comfortable with all the necessary amenities, the staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs and we loved the dinner we had at Fusion Bites. If we are ever in the area again we won't even look elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Very nice and customer service was good.
Summary: I stayed here with my mother and my daughter for 4 nights.  We planned a 5 night stay, but our business was over on Wednesday and we were able to change our flights to one day earlier.  Ayres was flexible to not charge us for the 5 night and we were able to leave and save some $$.  There was a manager and other front desk staff there that were very helpful in providing us with information about the Huntington Beach area.  Beach parking is free if you park a few blocks from the beach in the neighborhood.  Nice tip! Breakfast was ok.  Pool area was nice.  This was a business plus vacation trip so we tried to mix up some pleasure with a business trip.  *** Parking lot can be confusing the first time.  The parking lot entrance is only an entrance.  The exit is through the parking

We had a softball team and families stay at the hotel for 4-5 days.  Our group spent approximately $8,000 dollars with the hotel.  We were treated like it was an inconvenience to have us at the hotel.  From the first moment I stepped in and although we were a little early for check in... 12:30 pm instead of 3:00pm.  We were told to come back at 3:00.  Most hotels will see what they have a available but not this one.  It was just I can't check you in and no you can't pay now and then come back... just come back at 3:00.  After, we finally were checked in, if we had any kind of request it was as though it was an inconvenience.  We wanted to have a team dinner and asked if there was a room they might be willing to provide, We have had all our other hotels allow this made it
Manager Response: Dear wsilvan,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review and share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, your insight is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. Due to high occupancy this summer, any early check-in is difficult for accommodate. However, we happily provide early check-in when availability permits. We work hard to redefine hospitality, and it is apparent, in this case,  that we failed to do so. Thank you again for your review and I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: This hotel was wonderful in every way.  The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in for a hotel, or anywhere for that matter!  The pillows were dreamy!  Wish I could have taken one home. Was very quiet and the housekeeping service was top notch.  Breakfast was great, as was the coffee, which is always critical to morning meals. All staff was extremely helpful and friendly. As a frequent traveler, this was one of the best hotel experiences ever.

The Ayres was a wonderful stay!  Very centrally located in Huntington Beach area.  Clean, very well appointed, comfortable bed and excellent service. Complimentary breakfast was wonderful also. Will definitely stay here again!

The overall facility was nice and the room suited the price but that pool is just way too small for such a hotel size.  There seemed to be too many people yet there were only 20-30.  There was only room for a few people to sit and have shade of some kind.  There were at least 3-4 families complaining about it.
Manager Response: Dear rob_rdv,  Thank you for sharing your review about our hotel and your recent stay. Your praise regarding our accommodations is greatly appreciated. Thank you for voicing your concerns, we hope this does not keep you from returning to our hotel.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Our room was very spacious, comfortable and quiet, even though close to the elevator. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom had  a really large tub/shower stall, which was quite surprising and inviting after a long day.   The bed was very comfortable. The view was entirely of the roof about 3 feet away, but as we weren't really in the room for much of the day, it wasn't really a problem.  Front desk staff was great.  Very enjoyable stay.

Everything about this hotel and the staff employed just enhanced the relaxation of our trip and ability to thoroughly enjoy ourselves and not worry about anything with concerns to the room or being able to enjoy the hotel amenities.  The room was awesome and high quality.  Would definitely stay here again and again.

We had a very lovely time for two nights at the Ayres Fountain Valley. Everyone treated us so very well, even allowing me to change our room from two-queens to a king w/couch at the last minute due to my sore back and need to sit up to rest. Thank you to Leslie at the front desk/reception. And, of course, Rosa and Paula at Fusion Bites treated us like a queen and her princesses (my granddaughters), accommodating us in every manner we requested. Food was excellent and the service absolutely divine! We loved every minute at the pool and Jacuzzi spa and found it both fun and relaxing. We plan to return to this lovely hotel next year!

Shower wasn't good.  Couldn't take shower easy unless I bind myself.  Will not stay in the hotel unless I get different room from room 319.  Will not stay in hotel if all the rooms are same.  Hotel cleaning was great.  Air conditioning was great.
Manager Response: Dear Aziz J,  We kindly encourage our guests to voice any and all concerns immediately. Oftentimes we are more than happy to provide different accommodations if necessary. Thank you for your valuable insight!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary Heading: Best stay in California on 10 years
Summary: I travel to CA for business and personal, and thus hotel by far exceeded our expectations. The friendines of the staff was extremely personal. The hotel GM John was checking to make sure all aspects of our stay was  comfortable and pleasant. The restaurant Fusion Bites was unique in flavor/options and the service was super friendly. They had a local artist playing music the nihht we had dinner! The free breakfast each morning was excellent in quality and variety. The pool and jacuzzi was fantastic and very enjoyable, with nice lounge chairs and towels on each chair. The rooms were spacious and clean, with comfy beds and linens. The convenience to Anaheim, SNA airport, Huntington Beach, and Newport was super helpful. We will stay again, for sure!

I tend to leave negative reviews after a bad stay, but after repeated stays at this hotel, I have to say that it is reliably clean and the people that run it, very warm and professional.  I've stayed at this Ayres maybe 10 different times already.  The rooms are spacious, clean and it has a decent breakfast (included!)  I usually go there for business and sometimes I will even stay there even though I may even have business clear out in Santa Monica.  The rates are more than fair and like I say, it's always been very clean and I like the service....it is unusually good.  There is a particular manager there (after so many trips),  John Mathews.  He's always cheerful, always engaging and you see him everywhere there.  Usually at the front desk, I saw him helping out in the kitchen

Not my favorite Ayres Hotel.    Prefer Seal Beach location, or Anaheim if necessary, but they were booked at Seal Beach and the Anaheim location turned out to also be booked this past weekend; so we were stuck with HB/Fountain Valley.    Normally we would get a "check-in email" the day before arrival, never happened.  So I had to call that morning & make sure they knew we were going to be a VERY late arrival.  At that time, they confirmed our standing special requests for extra pillows & towels.  When we got to our room at 1AM after a 350+/mile, 11-hour trip, in tons of traffic; of course there were no extra pillows or towels...  This has happened at all three Ayres locations, they asked for special requests, confirmed them by text or verbally, but never bothered to honor them.
Manager Response: Dear ZynWoofChess,  Though we are happy to input your requests and confirm or review your requests, we are never able to truly guarantee them. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the confusion between us confirming the requests with you and actually guaranteeing the requests for you. Thank you for taking the time to provide vital feedback. Rest assured that we will use your insight to make improvements wherever necessary. Also, the room rate covers your overnight accommodations and complimentary amenities, a tip, which is optional, is considered customary as a token of appreciation for cleaning up after a guest. Though you may not require services on a daily basis, our exceptional housekeeping team must still clean up after you upon departure. I sincerely hope you future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary Heading: Casual with a Touch of Class
Summary: My wife and I stayed at this property while attending a wedding. I was surprised by how well the hotel is appointed: crown molding throughout the roomy hallways and guest rooms, lots of light, tasteful art everywhere. The linens are superb and the furniture is quite beautiful. Our room was spacious with a sitting area, king size bed, good size closet. The hot breakfast is quite tasty--lots of choices and freshly prepared.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with easy freeway access
Summary: We stayed here for a baseball tournament, so 10-11 year olds and their families.  The kids had fun in the pool and the rooms were spacious for our family of 4.  The bathroom doors are weird to open if someone is brushing their teeth and someone else is coming out of the bathroom it is a tight maneuver.  The rooms had a mini refrigerator and microwave so that was nice.  The staff was super friendly and helpful and breakfast was good for a free hotel breakfast.  They did not rotate the menu between the 2 days we stayed there but we survived.  I would stay in another Ayers in the future.

Great hotel and staff.  Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping team was extraordinarily kind.   Hotel is centrally located with lots of food and entertainment choices nearby.  Pool is just ok but I enjoyed the sitting area that was separate from the pool.  Breakfast was just ok - comparable to most hotel breakfasts.  My only complaint/recommendation would be to stay on the top floor.  I stayed on the 3rd and could hear every step they took.  My stay lasted for 16 days so there were several different people in the room during that time so it wasn't just one loud walker. I should've requested to move to the 4th floor but because I was staying so long, I had a lot of stuff and didn't want to repack everything to move up a floor.  I would've been happier if I hadn't been

Summary Heading: Not accommodating to hosting large groups with children
Summary: Each year we take part in a few softball tourney's in the LA areas,  Fountain Valley is a beautiful place with amazing fields.  This year our league booked us room at Ayres Hotel's.  So say disappointed would be nice.  It is obvious they have little to no experience on what to expect when booking out rooms which will have A LOT of kids at one time in their hotels.  Staff members in the lobby area were rude and short with kids from the age of 7-12, did not prepare other guests in the hotel by advising that they  were hosting many rooms for the Girls Softball league ( proactive approach), did not like the sitting/ lobby area to be used for people to lounge therefor had a very small stuffy room opened to put us there.  The experience was not good.  Pool was dirty/ cloudy and water

The front desk staff are very friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast is very good. Fusion Bites is the dinner restaurant located in the same location as breakfast.  USA Today is available daily.  A fitness center, pool, two business center computers and printer are available and outside seating is available.  The rooms are very large with high ceilings.  Décor is well done.  Coffee available in the room and a refrigerator is in the room. Easy freeway access.  Wi-Fi is also available and complimentary.

Newer hotel...I loved my stay! The rooms are HUGE! It was close to everything I was looking for. I'm just sorry my travel plans did not allow me to stay past one night. I will definitely stay here when in LA area again!

Aires Hotel was a great value. The hotel decor and fixtures were new, breakfast was good, nice outdoor area with couch and fire pit, and the staff was exceptionally helpful! Great place to stay for the size of the hotel. It isn't a destination hotel.

The hotel is brand new. Beautiful decor, comfortable rooms, friend'y staff! The pool isn't too big but big enough for the kids to have fun. We also like that the hotel was so close to the freeway. Lastly, they have electric vehicle parking and charging stations.

Clean room, friendly staff, perfect for overnight sports tournament. Loved the modern decor, location was perfect! Only complaint was breakfast. It was pretty much wiped out by 8 am. Nice that all the linens smelt smoke free.

For over a year now, I've stayed at this property for all my trips down to Orange County. It's become my home away from home. The hotel is immaculately cleaned, the staff are amazing, and the rooms are comfortable from every aspect. John Matthews is an amazing General Manager, whose hard work and dedication to excellence is felt throughout every step through the Ayres in Fountain Valley. My only complaint is with the lack of variety offered at the in-house restaurant (Fusion Bites), it's very limited and too niche for the casual traveler. I highly recommend this property for anyone looking for a comfortable yet luxurious place to stay in central Orange County.

WOW! overall a great experience, I have never stayed or even heard of Ayres but went with my instinct and went with it. Rooms were beyond a great size! Comfortable beds and all staff were beyond helpful!

Summary Heading: Put your hands in the Ayres!
Summary: Good location, big, clean and quiet rooms.  The complimentary breakfast is nicely done and has something for everyone.  The restaurant in the evening was quiet and the great waitress there was nice enough to turn on the Warriors game for us.  Very accommodating and pleasant.    Would definitely stay again as it was just a few miles from Disneyland and South Coast Plaza.  Lots of restaurants in the area too.    Well done Ayres staff!

Was in town to bowl in a tournament down the street. Hotel is easy to get in/out with plenty of good restaurants near by. Breakfast was good too. Room is decent sized and comfortable - would recommend a stay here if you are considering.

We made a quick trip to SoCal for our son's college graduation from Cal State Long Beach. He lives in Fountain Valley and was our ride for our brief stay, so we stayed at the Ayres property there. Our adult daughter was traveling with us. We enjoyed the spacious room. The oversized bathtub was too good to resist. When the tub stopper wouldn't work, I called the front desk. They sent someone right up. She assessed the problem and had it repaired within ten minutes. In the evening, my husband and son enjoyed the hot tub. And while the beds were soft, as some reviewers have noted, we all still slept well. We were up and out early and didn't have time to enjoy the free breakfast. But we did pop down for a glass of wine and appetizers at the onsite restaurant. That was a very nice

Stayed here for a trip to Disneyland.  Was a nice, quiet hotel and the beds were comfortable.  The only real issue was that the elevators are small.  The room was clean and the towels were plentiful.  The hotel is not too far from Disney and decent eateries.  Overall a really nice stay

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service/Attention to the small things
Summary: Upon arrival at the Ayres Hotel I immediately  found this location to be very clean, modern and presentable. The staff were very accommodating upon check in and the process was quick and efficient. I was assisted by Leslie who offered information about many local destinations I planned visiting during my stay The continental breakfast each morning was good for a quick meal before heading out with the family. This location was adjacent to a police station which brought me a degree of comfort. The area around the hotel is very nice and there is a local bar (Silky Sullivan's) which was a short 3 minute walk away. The bar was very festive and obviously a local favorite. Had a great time enjoy a drink and a little dancing before walking back to the hotel.. I highly recommend Ayres

Classy little hotel. Upscale rooms with fairly good amenities. Excellent breakfast included starting at 6 AM. Staff is top notch and very knowledgeable. Great location with easy access to local flavor. Check out Silky Sullivan's Irish Tavern one block away.

As usual, the Ayres in Fountain Valley, was first class the whole way.  From the cleanliness of the property to the friendly staff, the hotel never disappoints. I always stay at the Ayres when I'm in town and can't see that changing any time.
Manager Response: Dear Carlos G,  I am contented to read that our services did not disappoint. Thank you kindly for your loyalty to our hotel and the warm compliments you have provided our team with. We look forward to serving you in the future.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: This is a lovely little hotel that seemed mostly clean. Offers a nice breakfast that when I was here, was included with the room. I enjoyed the large TV with tons of cable options.  I liked that the sink and vanity were outside of where the toilet and shower/bath were so my family could all get ready separately. My only complaints - and I'm not one to complain or am ever picky - would be that the room smelled of laundry that had sat in the washing machine too long after washed; a very mildewy or musty smell. We stayed in a studio suite with a king sized bed. The bed was very, very soft which didn't really work out for me and my back (my problem only, though. Some like soft beds). One of my daughters slept in the bed with me and every time she rolled over, it made me sea sick. If

Was more than I expected!  Check-in customer service exceptional.  Room was very clean and a microwave and refrigerator in the room.  Had a laptop and printer in the hallway right outside our room.  Great breakfast buffet.  Hotel close to the police station!
Manager Response: Dear 335jenniec,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review based on your most recent stay. The compliments you have shared regarding our exceptional service are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for the feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Upon arrival, We were greeted like we were family! Everything was explained very well including points of interest in the area. The room was very nice and clean, bed was nice and comfortable...the pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. It was like we were actually on the beach! Hotel staff was very professional and friendly! Thank you for the wonderful hospitality!!
Manager Response: Dear Sharyl P,  I am thrilled to read about your recent experience at Ayres Hotel Fountain Valley. Our team strives to go above and beyond in order to provide exceptional service. I am delighted to see that we were able to do just that. Thank you so much for your kind compliments and the feedback you have provided us with. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here while visiting our son.  Our room was large and even had a sofa bed/couch and a desk.  Everything was clean, well decorated and included all that you'd need...fridge, coffee maker, large shower, and plenty of counter space and storage room.  Breakfast was plentiful (if a little crowded during peak times).  Enjoyed our stay.

My recent stay at Ayres Hotel Fountain Valley was fabulous. The room was cheerful,clean & cozy. Perfect after a day of fun in your city. Staff friendly & professional. Breakfast was pleasant too! Food served at good temp .I will definitely stay again.

The staff was very friendly and courteous.  The hotel itself was really nice, updated, and had comfortable beds.  The breakfast was very good, had a lot of options and a nice dining area.  You can eat inside or outside.  The hotel is also really close to the beach and to basically any amenity you may need.  Really convenient.  Money well spent!

Lovely big room, serviced and clean. Breakfast was awesome. Friendly staff. Close to Disneyland. Great hotel for families. Was very quiet. Their room service was delicious, yummy pizza!  Their laundry service is so ridiculously expensive though.

Really enjoyed our recent stay for business at Ayres, Fountain Valley. Very friendly/helpful staff and a very clean hotel. Rooms were comfortable and well appointed. Shame the bar didn't stay open later on weekdays (but maybe that's just a British requirement and you're only a short walk from a lively Irish Bar!). Really comfortable and welcoming stay.

My kids and I stayed in a K with pull out sofa. The room was clean and comfortable.  We would have enjoyed the large tub but the stopper would not stay closed.  Our room was near a side entrance and we were awakened early in the morning by slamming doors - the entry door slammed closed loudly as well as the other room doors.  Breakfast was nothing special - overall if you are looking for a clean, basic hotel, the Ayres is a good choice.

I stay here every time I am in town for business (if they have rooms available).  The hotel and rooms are all very clean and the staff are very friendly.  They have a nice workout room, pool and outside area to relax in the evening.  Breakfast is provided in the morning with a nice variety of items.  A restaurant is on site if you chose to not go out to eat which is average but a lot of good restaurants close by.

I've stayed at the Ayers on several occasions and it's  always felt like home to me. The service is impeccable and the staff is really nice. I would recommend the Ayers Fountain Valley EVERYTIME to everyone.

Summary Heading: Well kept, super clean, quiet, convenient, and excellent friendly staff
Summary: The manager John really makes you feel welcome as does the rest of the staff.  I regularly stay here to take my wife to her Dr.'s in OC.  The place is always spotless, comfy beds, huge tubs in the rooms if you request tub room. Food is free and pretty average but again it is included.  Even have a little bar for a cocktail. EZ on and off the 405 FWY. Highly recommend it.

My family and I stayed for 1 night for a baseball tournament in the area. We had the 2 Queens and the room was immaculate (and I am a very picky person)!! The beds were extremely comfortable, the a/c worked perfectly, and plenty of towels were in the room. We didn't have time to use or see the pool. Breakfast was delicious and the breakfast staff was very courteous, and friendly! Various breakfast options like: sausage, waffles, bread, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, eggs,  and potatoes. Most of all, I loved that this hotel was very CLEAN!
Manager Response: Dear momof4kidz,  I am thrilled to hear that our accommodations and the cleanliness of our hotel met your expectations. Thank you so much for your kind compliments regarding our friendly team  and delicious breakfast. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Ayres with a wedding group for one night. Front desk was super-friendly and very accommodating. We arrived at the hotel at 9.30 am,and the staff allowed early check in without any additional charge!! We did inform the hotel  a week before about our early arrival. Nonetheless, allowing us to check in without any additional charge is exemplary in my opinion. As to the rooms, they were very clean. A/C worked great! Computer room can print your Southwest boarding pass. Food was great. Breakfast was free and good! Free WiFi!in the room. Close to 405 Freeway! All in all, great place to stay and would certainly recommend to any one without reservations.
Manager Response: Dear Surendr S,  Thank you for writing a review on TripAdvisor! I am contented to see that you enjoyed your stay and the level of service our team provided. We make every effort to accommodate our valued guests and I am glad to see that we did just that by being able to provide you with an early check-in. The valuable insight you have lent us is greatly appreciated, as is the recommendation you have made of our hotel. We look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: I had a top-floor king room in the FV Ayres and stayed nearly a week. It was so cool, I am already booked for a return couple of weeks in July - with a weekend at the Ayres Redlands in between.   I have no complaints about the stay whatsoever. From the staff, to the room, to the food in the restaurant, to the gym, to the pool, to the parking, etc. etc. It was all really well thought out. I slept well, it was quiet, and I felt very comfortable and safe.  The wifi was a bit weak on the top floor, so you'll need to bring your lan cord, or borrow one from the front desk. But other than that, just a fantastic stay.

Exceeded expectations for the price.  Very clean, quiet, tastefully decorated, and friendly, efficient service. Breakfast was good and offered several healthy choices. We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear jspracher,  I could not be happier to hear that our team exceeded your expectations. Delivering exceptional customer service and providing spotless accommodations are two of our highest priorities. It is great to hear that we able to do just that during your visit. Thank you kindly for your feedback and we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: The Ayres hotel was perfect for my trip.  The room was in excellent condition, the restaurant was very good, and it is in close proximity of great spots like Silky Sullivans.  It had everything I needed!!!
Manager Response: Dear kmsnas,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience at Ayres Hotel Fountain Valley. I am thrilled to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your accommodations as well as our optimal location. Your feedback is greatly valued and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing Property! We love Ayres Hotels!
Summary: Everything was perfect since the minute I stepped into the Front Lobby, The Front Desk Clerk by the last name of "Longworth" was very attentive, he had a big smile in his face and quickly greeted us with "How may I help you?" Following that as he checked in my reservation, I was amazed by the huge lobby & how spacious it is, I then peeked over to the breakfast room & they were serving dinner!! Now the room, BIG WOW! Great location quiet room, fresh and super clean! The bed was amazing I had a great sleep! Next morning, breakfast ran smoothly, everything was very well prepared, we left the hotel with a full tummy. Just wish we would have used the pool, but due to the weather conditions we preferred not too. But we will definitely book again here!!

Summary Heading: Great stay for a family! Great location!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days, it was great with a child. Breakfast was served every morning and they had everything! Nice pool and outdoor sitting area. We would definitely stay there again! Great location!

My room was clean and comfortable.  The room has a mini refrigerator and microwave; just perfect for my 2-day stay.  The receptionist was friendly and courteous, as were the housekeepers.  Breakfast is served every morning so I didn't need to go out and get breakfast.  Super convenient!

Summary Heading: Great very clean place. Very friendly staff
Summary: This place was very nice, very clean. I'm not very big on staying at hotels due to germs and not being clean. I bring my own sheets, pillows and wash cloths. I wipe everything down. I didn't bring my bedding this time but was ok with it. I felt ok in their bedding. I would stay again and not bring my own bedding.

I give Ayres an excellent rating! Beautiful room, excellent breakfast and great service. Their breakfast are always good and an added treat to the relaxed stay. Their locations are always easy to find. We've always been comfortable staying at Ayres. Will always be a loyal Ayres guest!

My wife and I travel several times a year to Orange County to see our granddaughters and take them to Disneyland.  The hotel we most like and have been the best is the Ayers in Fountain Valley.  The staff is always friendly, eager to help and smiles are abundant.  We several more trips planned and are already booked.  You will love the place.

I stayed in this hotel due to a business meeting and its premises are excellent. The conference room is good and service is great. The hotel is conveniently located just some miles away malls if you're staying for pleasure. Rooms are comfortable and really clean. You'll enjoy your stay here!

Stayed 2 nights in March.  Our room was very clean in fact felt brand new.  The hotel itself was exceptionally clean and felt new.   Everything in our room was clean and tidy.  The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the walls are thin and you can hear next door and upstairs.  But for the price and location it was impressive.  Oh yea, free wifi that was good and free  breakfast (hot and cold) which was very good.

the bed is comfortable. and love the bathroom. personally, fourth floor is better than first floor due to myself experience. good gym enviroment and dinner is quite delicious . the waitress is vey kind and genty.

I made a reservation for a handicap room. When entering the room I noticed you could not get into the bath tub. Most handicap rooms you can tool in or step over a small lip. The bathtub was 2 1/2 feet high. Had bars but some of us are unable to step over this height. I was not able to shower at all. Plus not a comfortable chair in the room. A tiny roll chair at the desk without arms again unacceptable for handicapped people plus the other chair hard vinyl and no arms. Very disappointed in this. A nice hotel and breakfast was good.

Beautiful facility, fantastic staff. Excellent breakfast. Rooms are clean and well appointed, beds are comfy. Parking was a bit tight. Location was ideal for our trip reasons.  Would consider a return if ever in the area again.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for Team Events
Summary: Our travelling sports team stayed here for 3 days. We are thankful and appreciative of the management and supporting staff for our incredible stay. We will absolutely stay here again.  The Front desk attended to our every request, in the most friendly and professional manner. The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. The free breakfast is not to be missed.

I am in Fountain Valley for business and pleasure at least 6 times/year and I have been staying at this Ayres since they opened - Staff is consistently professional and always pleasant and I note they've been constant since the opening which says it's not only a good place to stay, but a good place to work too.

I had never stayed at an Ayers property before and wasn't sure what to expect.  We stayed for 2 nights while in Fountain Valley visiting some relatives. This hotel seemed brand new and was very clean.  The in-room amenities were all as advertised and everything worked great.  The beds were comfy, the bathroom spacious and spotless.  The included breakfast was delicious.  The outdoor patio was a great place to relax while we waited for our other family members in the area.   The evening entertainment was good the first night (solo performer), and the Karaoke on Friday night was popular though not our cup of tea.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

Arrived from a long flight from midwest and encountered  bit of traffic coming in from LAX so by the time I got to the hotel was just wanting to check in. Upon arrival I was greeted by the guest service rep and it was a very nice experience. Polite and professional checked in quickly and then off to my room.  Was very pleased with room and location from hotel to my children's home is great. Had a great night sleep and the pillows are the best.

To echo other reviewers, if you want a clean, comfortable place to stay, this is it!  We were there two nights and were impressed with both the room and the staff.  We will stay here again when we're in the area.  The rooms are great.  The bed was so comfortable.  And clean.  Let me stress how clean the hotel is.  Breakfast is better than the usual free hotel breakfast.  Also, the hot items changed a bit the second day, which was nice.  Besides the usual cereal, toast, and pastries, they offered scrambled eggs, a breakfast meat, and potatoes.  Also, my husband must eat gluten-free, and the chef there knew what had gluten and what didn't.  The breakfast capped off the great stay there.

We had the opportunity to stay at the Ayres Fountain Valley while our home was being termited.  If you have gone through this experience you know how absolutely exhausting it is.  Our days were long and to be able to come to this beautiful hotel for a couple of days was just the brief recharge we needed.  The experience was wonderful.

The room and rest of the hotel was very clean and quiet. The staff from our room attendant to the manager was always friendly. They offered entertainment Friday night. Complimentary breakfast was well done. We did eat dinner one night at Fusion Bites. It was only okay for me, but the drinks were good. We would definitely stay again.

We stayed here one night for a quick 24 trip to see a concert. We were able to book this last minute. Beds were very comfortable, hotel rooms very clean. Rates were reasonable too! No complaints here :) The pool area looked great but it was too chilly for us to use.

Summary Heading: Nice quiet, clean, friendly home away from home
Summary: We stayed just one night.  The new shower configuration especially impressed us; no more taking a shower in a tub!  The location was wonderful for our errands and squeezing in a beach bike ride along Huntington Beach.  The breakfast was nice, although Redlands' Ayres has the best breakfast in the chain!  The staff was friendly and very accommodating.  Even though our phones gave us maps of the area, it would have been nice to have a local map available at the front desk.  All in all, this was an excellent facility and had a perfect location for our short visit to OC.

This hotel is very clean and nicely done..definitely exceeds my expectations for a 3-star hotel.  The rooms are spacious, the wireless worked really well and the fitness center had a combination of machines, free weights and cardio.  A pretty decent gym!  Check in was speedy and the bed was comfortable.

Summary Heading: An incredibly nice hotel for a very reasonable price!
Summary: I recently stayed for a weekend at this hotel. It was an incredible surprise. This is a great hotel. The decor is very modern and clean. The rooms are large and the beds are very comfy. The bathrooms are also large with many hooks.

Friendly Staff and clean room. Very easy check in and out. Will stay here again when near the area. Stayed here for a wedding down the street and made great accommodations. Bed was extremely comfortable.

The reception staff were excellent, professional, friendly and kind. The room was super quiet and very clean. The AC/heating (fan) took some getting used to. The breakfast was not exceptionally good. But all in all a very good hotel.

Excellent hotel. Lobby and rooms are beautiful. Asian Bites is very good for dinner. Hot breakfast is very good. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay at any of the hotels in this chain based on our experience here.  Location is also great and next to the 405.

This Hotel was build 2 Years Ago, everything inside is still smell new, The place is very clean, The staff is very friendly, The price was low since We stayed there during weekday , the place was next to the Police Station so That was a Plus .

Summary Heading: Very Good Place To Visit Orange County
Summary: Very nice, clean and relatively new hotel. Staff is very friendly, helpful and courteous. Complimentary hot breakfast is plentiful and fresh. Very good location, close to beach, shopping, regional airport and many restaurants.  Walking distance to the beautiful Mile Square Park. Although access to the hotel with a one way entry could be confusing to first time visitors, but the stay is worthwhile. We stayed here for 3 nights and decided to return to this hotel for one more night after our out of town trip because we appreciated the excellent service of the staff and a comfortable room.

This is a beautiful hotel fairly new and very well maintained,the staff are very efficient and nothing is too much trouble.I also like the fact that they cater for disabled people , ie rooms with special features for deaf and blind people  ,they've tried to think of everything to accomadate everyone .I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again .

Quiet and Clean. The Staff was very helpful and made mine and my children's stay very pleasant. This hotel is perfectly situated for easy access to the freeway as well as only a short distance from the beautiful Huntington Beach pier. I highly recommend this place!

I am a former hotel manager and my husband a retired pilot.  We have stayed in many hotels from expensive to cheap.  We reserved a last minute room at The Ayres in Fountain Valley for a baseball tournament in Huntington Beach.  The price was very reasonable but the most impressive thing was the cleanliness of the hotel.  It was so clean that it was unexpectedly noticeable.  If there is one thing that makes a difference on my top 5 priorities of a hotel it is cleanliness.  This hotel scored over the highest mark for that.  Literally every inch of this hotel was spotless.  Also, the young lady who checked us in was very personable and friendly.  Very much appreciated after a long day.  The breakfast in the morning was just fine as you had a choice of hot or cold types of food and

We picked out this hotel for the previous good reviews and great price. They were all true and we had a great stay there. The room was spacious and must have been recently updated as it was in great shape. A very comfortable room and a great nights sleep. I appreciate all the conservation approaches this hotel has taken even with the electricity. It was right off the 405 highway and was 9 miles to Disneyland and an easy route there each morning. The have a free breakfast that has a great selection of both warm and cold foods with a chef who is preparing everything. The free parking was a great bonus also. I would stay here again on our next trip.

Close to beaches, restaurants and shopping malls. New hotel, clean and nicely decorated rooms, lobby and outside patio. Great family hotel. Decent continental breakfast. Restaurant in lobby for dinner

I have been staying at this property almost weekly for four months now, and what stands out most is the property managers, and staff's, focus on repeatability. My first visit in 2013 was five star, and looking back now, in 2016, it is still five star! The property is a top end boutique property in a busy location, but you would never know it. As you enter the lobby life slows down, and as a business part time traveler, that is exactly what I want most!  If you find yourself desiring a quiet property, offering the perfect environment for dumping your busy days thoughts and clearing your head, while you remain in the thick of the Orange County bustle, you would thoroughly enjoy this location.

Room and area were well maintained, was expecting a little different for breakfast options. A little sparse on parking in front, but grounds were well maintained as well for decent presentation. Personnel were polite, but my reservations were not in system when I arrived, even though I had confirmation.

I normally love this hotel.  After starting a work-out routine at home I was looking forward to continuing by using the fitness room in Fountain Valley.  It was SO disappointing to learn that it was under construction.  The desk clerk didn't mention this at check-in.  Later I asked if they'd made arrangements to partner with a local gym and was told they hadn't. Discount rates would have been a great way to handle this.

We stayed at Ayres over the holidays for several days. The location was fantastic! Right off 405 - and many other streets - super easy to get to the coast or Disney. The rooms were large, clean and quiet. Nice pool/Jacuzzi but it was not warm enough weather to enjoy. The breakfast offerings were crazy!  So much to choose from and really good hot meal ... not the usual coffee/cake offerings at similar properties. The restaurant where they serve breakfast (Fusion) had truly great food for dinner!    Next time in HB - we'll stay here again. It was a great value and enjoyable stay.

Summary Heading: Not a great experience this trip
Summary: Arrived at the hotel to find the work out center closed due to construction.  No business center due to a water leak, no options or solutions provided by the staff.  Come guys, this is a business hotel.  Sometimes we need to print things.  Shower takes forever to get warm in the morning, missing light bulbs in my room, maybe they are saving energy.  Overall this hotel although new, needs some work.  Positive is they do have a decent breakfast and the breakfast staff is very good.

The staff at the hotel were very accommodating.  We were coming to California for an impromptu family reunion and more or less took over the lobby one evening. The beds are genuinely comfortable and the rooms were very clean and well appointed.  This was important as we spent over a week at this hotel..  It was a great place to base our local travels from.

I really wanted to give this hotel a 5, but there were a couple of (hopefully temporary) glitches. The room was great: beds were soft, tub was big, wifi speed was fast, maid gave us an extra comforter. Figuring out the h/c is a little tricky. Hallway smelled like paint. Construction on 1st floor wing with gym, so no exercise room or computer room. Hot tub wouldn't come on when we tried (hint to management). Breakfast was good though. The waffle iron makes 4 mini waffles, which is good for a family. Full range buffet. Will go back.

Summary Heading: Families Needing Accommodations in Fountain Valley, CA Area
Summary: If your family is looking for spacious and clean accommodations near Newport Beach or Costa Mesa, this is the right hotel.  Conveniently located off the 405, the hotel is clean with recently remodeled sleeping rooms.  Rooms are large with pull-out couch, blankets and sheets in the closet. Bathrooms also spacious, large tub and good shower.  Breakfast is included, although the food is exceedingly mediocre: the usual scrambled eggs and potatoes, a few mostly sweet cereals, pastries from a box, toast, thin juice and pretty good coffee.  While I cannot speak for the rest of the year, over the Christmas holidays, the hotel was filled with families, so breakfast (between 6 and 9) was crowded and noisy.  Fortunately, the rooms are pretty sound proof and the noise from the dozens of

My husband and I stay at Ayres while visiting our son and his family. We have two grandsons and Ayres is close to their schools and their home. We enjoy a delicious breakfast every morning and have a place to relax and rest.  Our family even uses Ayres as a place to visit while we are staying there. Our daughter-in-law doesn't   have to worry about clean sheets, where we will sleep, clean towels and bathrooms.  We don't have to worry about disturbing everyone with the many trips to the bathroom during the night. Ayres is always very welcoming, clean, attractive and personal. We are close to shopping, school sports events,  theaters, Disney Land and other fun activities. Ayres is right off the freeway and easy to get in and out .

The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly (They remembered and addressed by name each time I went to main desk.) and it was central to many good eating places. The restaurant in the hotel stayed open for a special large family event of at least 40 people but was not adequately staffed. (This is my only criticism).

Summary Heading: This is a very well managed property, I would definitely recommend it
Summary: We stayed 2 nights visiting family. It was convenient to the I405 freeway and there were many services nearby. The room was large and clean. The bed and bedding very nice and comfortable. A buffet breakfast was included in our rate and it was excellent with all the usual items. We have been impressed with Ayres during another stay and this is one we would come back to if the opportunity arises.

Excellent location, good restaurant, big rooms and very nice people. It also has a business center and a really complete gym open 24 hrs.  There is an outside seating area to unwind after a long day of work, shopping or visiting the local attractions

What a great Hotel. From the moment I walked in to the beautiful lobby, warm welcoming front desk to the Gorgeously decorated comfortable guest room, i really enjoyed my stay. The breakfast room was really nice with all kinds of Breakfast hot and cold foods. I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anybody in the local area.
Manager Response: Dear TravellingCarmen,  It is wonderful to hear that you found our accommodations to your liking. I appreciate your kind words and are humbled by your recommendations of our hotel. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Comfy, Traffic noise is a little loud. Beautiful remodel, Great beds, Close to everything. Walking distance from Restaurants , bars, stores,  We only stayed one night , but would have loved to stay longer. Thank you Ayres for the awesome service. We will definitely start looking at staying at Ayres more often. This was our first time and it was great. Customer services was very good. Thanks again!
Manager Response: Dear HandyRocky,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience on TripAdvisor. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and took advantage of our optimal location. Thank you so much for your kind words. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: I went with my family and it was  an amazing experience !  Since we checked in until we leaft they made us feel as family ! The hotel is great located and it is extremely clean and big.  John the front desk manager welcomed us with a warmful smile and his staff too. We had amazing breakfast every morning with a nice variety of food. Pool and jacuzzi area is beautiful and it has a bonfire area with sofas around where you can enjoy at night. Business center is amazing located and it has everything that you need to amke your trip pleasent. Gym impecable. Rooms are bign and bathrooms too. Paola from housekeeping was great and friendly. Last but not least fusion bites is a great restaurant with exquisite menu. Thank you all for an amazing time !!!!
Manager Response: Dear Soledad F,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed as our team works diligently to leave a lasting impression with each of our guests. We hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Nice, clean rooms. Great staff. Good breakfast. There is no free evening happy hour, as there is with some Ayres Hotels. Also no draft beer, only bottles at the restaurant bar. Parking is also a little different in that you enter on Brookhaven, but exit the hotel off Slater. The fountain Valley Police Department is right next door.

Enjoyed my stay.  Everything was excellent and I highly recommend it. Very friendly staff, very clean, the breakfast was very good and the location easy to find. I  would definitely stay here again, very enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear max9995,  Thank you for reviewing your recent stay with us. It is always a pleasure to offer our valued guests warm and friendly service. Thank you for your kind compliments and we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: The hotel is the cleanest and well maintained hotel I have ever stayed in.  Spacious king-bed room, with high ceilings and large walk-in shower.  Friendly, helpful staff from housekeeper to general manager.  Quiet location is lots of parking.  If you are security conscious, it is next to the local police station.
Manager Response: Dear D K,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review in regards to your recent stay at our hotel. We truly appreciate the kind compliments you had to share and are delighted to hear that you had such a pleasant getaway at our hotel. Thank you again for your kind review and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Took my baseball team to Ayres Hotel and it was a great experience! Everything from breakfast to the beds were just how I expected it to be. The hotel was clean and staff was amazing.. We will be back!!!

everything was great except the exterior patio area was VERY dirty.  Food, cigarets were just left on the floor and the sofa.  It looked like the patio furniture needed refurbishing and someone taking the time to arrange and fluff pillows on a regular basis.  It was shocking as compare to the rest of the hotel.  The staff cleaned tables for dishes, emptied the garbage and never swept the floor.  We stayed for 3 days in it was gross every single day.

Our first stay with this small S. CA boutique chain and we were very impressed.  The price was fantastic for the amenities and newness of the location in Huntington Beach/Fountain Valley was perfect.  Clean facility, professional, well trained staff and just off the 405 if you are in need of a place for business stay.  We enjoyed a bottle of champagne(we purchased at Costco) one eve by the pool & outdoor fire pit.  They were very kind to give us glass stemware too.  I would stay there again when in the area.  It is not at the beach but drive straight up several miles and you are there.

As comfortable as ever in a hotel. Great service. Enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi with my family. Would definitely go back because I felt safe and my family as well. Only thing I would like to see would be the TV control a lil bit more functional

Hotel was very accommodating. Was helped before even arriving and then was able to check-in early by a wonderful staff member, Selma. Appreciated having her as the first person I saw when arriving and last person I saw leaving. Beautiful, spacious rooms. Great breakfast and coffee. Nice fitness room.

The first room was clean, but the TV did not work, so I packed up my things and was given another room.  I was there for 3 days and it was very nice and the staff was very friendly.  I ran out of Kleenex and the staff was prompt and brought me a new box.  The hotel was in a good location and close to an event I was attending.  It would have been nice if there was an evening restaurant in the hotel.

Top notch hotel. Bar and restaurant in the hotel are the best. Breakfast is included and it is a full breakfast. I will be back again. Beds are soft and comfortable. Bathroom is spacious. Mini fridge and micro wave come in handy. This is the best Ayres Hotel that I have stayed at
Manager Response: Dear Jim O,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you for your recent visit to the area! I appreciate the time you took to write a review on TripAdvisor informing others of your recent experience at our hotel. I am humbled to read that you found our hotel to be top notch. I appreciate your kind compliments and look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel, super clean, friendly staff specially Summer (front desk). The continental breakfast is excellent, nice pool. I really recommend this hotel, we are definitely going to stay there again next time.

My Husband  & I really enjoyed our Stay there. It really is A First Class Hotel with Very Good Rates. The Hotel Staff are Very Pleasant and Professional. the Hotel Décor is Exquisite, and the Hotel  is Very Clean. Our room was Spacious and Comfortable. We had everything we needed. We only stayed one night  because , it was all we needed for attending a concert at the Segerstrom in Costa Mesa. I would of loved to have stayed more nights. The location is great , close to Just about Everything you would need. Good main streets, and the Freeway is close by.

Everyone on the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially Mishel, Lauren, and John.   The conference room set-up was exactly what we wanted and was done well in advance of our event.  Guest rooms were spacious and clean and the "mini" kitchen came in handy.  The location was great for restaurants...plenty of choices.

Very clean hotel, friendly staff they were always ready to make your stay comfortable, we enjoyed our stay very much, next time we go to Fountain Valley this is where we will definitely stay. Breakfast was fresh and hot every morning.  Have only one suggestion if you are staying more than one day, breakfast needs more variety. Location is great close to restaurants, beautiful South Coast Plaza Mall, close access to freeway, 15-20 minute drive and you are at the beach.

Great Room..Great Service..Best hotel I stayed ever. Will be staying in this hotel whenever I come to Fountain Valley. Only disappointing thing - there is no indoor spa, otherwise I loved this hotel..
Manager Response: Dear Rajesh T,  I appreciate the kind compliments you have shared with fellow TripAdvisor travelers and am delighted to read that we were able to provide top notch service during you stay. Thank you for your feedback and I look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by the Ayres Hotel in Fountain Valley. First of all, hotel is close to the freeway and only a couple miles from the beach. The lobby and hallways are large, airy, and modern. I could even smell new wood and new paint? Our room had 2 comfy double beds, a very large tub, and a separate area for the bathroom sink (important for families). There were plenty of towels. There was a microwave, minifridge, coffeemaker, and blowdryer.  Our room was on the top floor and we had a nice, high ceiling. I usually have a hard time sleeping in hotels, but I slept very well at Ayres. I did not hear any noise, the air-conditioner worked well, and the beds were so comfortable!!  Icing on the cake, was continental breakfast. The eating area is large and modern. Items at
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to host your recent visit to Fountain Valley! I am delighted to read that we exceeded your expectations in terms of value, service, accommodations, and amenities. Our team works diligently to provide exceptional service to each of our guests and are humbled when we hit our mark! Thank you for your kind compliments concerning our exclusive full American breakfast. We look forward to many more stays!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: I'll keep it simple: clean, comfortable, COMFORTABLE BEDS, big room, quiet air, large bathroom, nice soaps & shampoos, fridge, microwave, coffee in room, very friendly staff, delicious breakfast with lots of choices. I've only stayed at Ayres once before in Seal Beach and it was just as nice. I will actively search out Ayres from now on.

We stayed here 2 nights and really liked this hotel. The location is great and there was plenty of parking. Its the newest hotel in the area, it's contemporary and beautifully decorated. The rooms are large, nicely appointed, and have huge walk in showers with amazing water pressure.  The refrigerator was good size, the air conditioning was excellent.  The cons: The carpet had a large stain in a prominent area, and people could be heard tromping in the room above us one of the nights. While the breakfast room was bright and quite attractive, the food choices were fair.  The oatmeal was very good but the milk was sour both mornings.  Staff were friendly and professional. The manager was very nice and responsive to our comments.  We would definitely stay here again and highly
Manager Response: Dear Travelingmama52,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us! Although there were a couple of inconsistencies during your visit, I am pleased to see that our friendly and professional team was prompt in rectifying said inconsistencies. We strive to provide world-class service and accommodations that we would expect for ourselves when traveling. I appreciate your kind compliments and hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Last minute stay while in town from Texas excellence in every aspect highly recommend anyone to stay staff was amazing hotel was beautiful was an excellent value for the price didnt get to try the on site restaurant but menu looked good

Very nice decor. Room was simple but clean. I had an accessible room so the tub was not as big as I read in other reviews but it was fine. The breakfast area was very nice and the spread was really good. Pleasant surprise. The pool, hot tub and gym were very nice and laundry service was very convenient. Service staff were also friendly and helpful. Only one day did I come back to a messy room which we expected to be serviced. Overall a great hotel and I would stay in another ayres hotel in a heartbeat if the standards such as these are consistent. Thank you! :)
Manager Response: Dear Priscilla,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you and for sharing a review of your recent stay with us! I am thrilled to read that you found our luxurious accommodations, welcoming team members, and exclusive amenities to your liking. At Ayres, we strive to provide consistent service across each of our 22 hotels and resort within our collection. We are humbled when our valued guests take notice of this. Looking forward to many more stays!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary Heading: Staying here waiting for my 1st grandchild
Summary: The hotel seems new exterior and interior very nice and clean. Check in was easy . Room is big , furnishings new. We had a double queen room with a divide between the beds which at first seemed strange but ended up liking it . Room had fridge , closet , desk . Bathroom was spacious. It came with a nice breakfast at the lounge area in the entry. It had a homemade waffle machine which was great. The pool and outdoor lounge area was nice and big. A very good experience .
Manager Response: Dear Gary,  Thank you for taking the time to submit a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our well-appointed accommodations and exclusive amenities, including our scrumptious full breakfast! We hope to see you back very soon. Thank you again for your kind compliments.  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: First off, the lovely Ladies at the front desk had the biggest smile ever. Very warm demenor.  I felt welcome and at ease. Very professional and knowledgeable. Comforable bed and clean room. The hallway was clean and everything was in place. Great Breakfast. The outdoor surroundings was in order. I highly recommend this hotel. It better then some of the other hotels  I've stay in Las Vegas. (I have only one Minor concern , in my room, the refrigerator was leaking water on the floor. I throw extra towel to hold back the leak.) But over all this Hotel  is #1 on my list to stay.

Everything about this hotel is great!  The hotel lobby is very nice and inviting, the front desk staff great.  I really like the rooms. Clean, comfortable, nice furnishings, beds are awesome! The onsite restaurant has a good happy hour, food is great. Locals even hang out here. Complimentary breakfast is really good too. Everything about the Ayres Fountain Valley is great!  I travel to the area twice a month and always stay here.  Can't say enough good things about the hotel and staff.  Excellent!!
Manager Response: Dear Julie,  Thank you for submitting a review for fellow TripAdvisor travelers as well as our team! I am quite pleased to see that we exceeded your expectations in terms of exceptional service, value, and accommodations. It is always humbling to read that our entire team has left a lasting impression with first time and loyal guests, such as yourself, alike! We look forward to making more memories with you!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: We had a wonderful time at the Ayres for the night of our wedding. The location was close to our venue and convenient by shuttle transfer. The staff did a great job distributing welcome bags to our guests, and greeted us with a bottle of champagne and chocolates when we arrived to the room after our wedding. Lovely night!
Manager Response: Dear Kathleen T,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor informing others of your recent stay at our hotel. We are thrilled to see that you had a wonderful time and that our hotel was in a location conducive to your needs. Thank you for your kind compliments and the review you have provided. We hope to welcome you back soon to make more memories!  Sincerely,  John Mathews General Manager

Summary: Fantastic service.  Great breakfast.  Comfortable and clean rooms.  Free parking.   It's a 10.  Check in was easy and no extra surprise fees.  We've stayed here before always good.  Safe environment and easy off on freeway access

we stayed over night for our daughters  sporting event, it was very comfortable we were very pleased !! Close to shopping and freeway access. would recommend to friends and other teams for sure. A+++++

my first impression was how beautifully decorated the hotel is, and the concierge was very friendly and knowledgeable. My room was lovely, comfortable and clean. I ordered room service for dinner and it was delicious and reasonably priced.

I had a surgery performed at the local Hospital. The Hotel is very conveniently located.  I came the night before surgery with my Mother.  I brought her to help with my after care.  I was going to go home the next day. I was unfortunately not able to.  We stayed a whole week for my recovery.  The staff would ask my Mom how I was feeling and if I was okay everyday.  They discounted the room to a Hospital rate which I didn't even know was a thing.  One of the days I was feeling up to go in the car to go through a drive thru. We left while they were cleaning the room.  When we got back they were not done. The connected restaurant was nice enough to let us sit and eat there while we waited.  The cleaning services always gave me extra conditioner because I have long hair.  They were

First time staying at this hotel after researching online. It was a last minute planned trip to visit my brother in Westminister.  The service from the employees was excellent... they always acknowledged you... that's a Dealbreaker for me when I pay attention to service.  Luved the ambiance of the lobby.  The room itself was excellent, great king bed, vaulted ceiling... wifi was a little slow but then again it was free.  Didn't try the complimentary breakfast but the Clientele were packing it in. I wouldn't definitely stay here and be a regular.  Marvin

We chose the Ayres to reserve a block of rooms for our out of area guests for our daughter's wedding. Ayres worked with us to make it cost effective for our family. The lobby is very attractive. Our rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were warm and welcoming. The outside area with pool and fire pit were wonderful for relaxing. The breakfast in the morning was just right.
